t: Psalm 22
Why Have You Forsaken Me?
To the choirmaster: according to The Doe of the Dawn. A Psalm of David.
My*pn God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why*ld are you so far from saving me, from the words of my groaning?
O*ln my God, I cry by day, but you do not answer, and*ld by night, but I find no rest.
Yet*pn you are holy, enthroned*ld on the praises of Israel.
In*ln you our fathers trusted; they*ld trusted, and you delivered them.
To*ln you they cried and were rescued; in*ld you they trusted and were not put to shame.
But*pn I am a worm and not a man, scorned*ld by mankind and despised by the people.
All*ln who see me mock me; they*ld make mouths at me; they wag their heads;
“He*ln trusts in the Lord;*s let him deliver him; let*ld him rescue him, for he delights in him!”
Yet*pn you are he who took me from the womb; you*ld made me trust you at my mother’s breasts.
On*ln you was I cast from my birth, and*ld from my mother’s womb you have been my God.
Be*ln not far from me, for*ld trouble is near, and*ld there is none to help.
Many*pn bulls encompass me; strong*ld bulls of Bashan surround me;
they*ln open wide their mouths at me, like*ld a ravening and roaring lion.
I*pn am poured out like water, and*ld all my bones are out of joint; my*ln heart is like wax; it*ld is melted within my breast;
my*ln strength is dried up like a potsherd, and*ld my tongue sticks to my jaws; you*ld lay me in the dust of death.
For*pn dogs encompass me; a*ld company of evildoers encircles me; they*ln have pierced my hands and feet—
I*ln can count all my bones— they*ln stare and gloat over me;
they*ln divide my garments among them, and*ld for my clothing they cast lots.
But*pn you, O Lord,*s do not be far off! O*ld you my help, come quickly to my aid!
Deliver*ln my soul from the sword, my*ld precious life from the power of the dog!
Save*ld me from the mouth of the lion! You*ln have rescued me from the horns of the wild oxen!
I*pn will tell of your name to my brothers; in*ld the midst of the congregation I will praise you:
You*ln who fear the Lord,*s praise him! All*ld you offspring of Jacob, glorify him, and*ld stand in awe of him, all you offspring of Israel!
For*ln he has not despised or abhorred the*ld affliction of the afflicted, and*ln he has not hidden his face from him, but*ld has heard, when he cried to him.
From*pn you comes my praise in the great congregation; my*ld vows I will perform before those who fear him.
The*ln afflicted shall eat and be satisfied; those*ld who seek him shall praise the Lord!*s May*ld your hearts live forever!
All*pn the ends of the earth shall remember and*ld turn to the Lord,*s and*ln all the families of the nations shall*ld worship before you.
For*ln kingship belongs to the Lord,*s and*ld he rules over the nations.
All*pn the prosperous of the earth eat and worship; before*ld him shall bow all who go down to the dust, even*ld the one who could not keep himself alive.
Posterity*ln shall serve him; it*ld shall be told of the Lord to the coming generation;
they*ln shall come and proclaim his righteousness to a people yet unborn, that*ld he has done it.
